The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I definitely grew as both a writer and as an art historian through the process of writing the senior essay.

This thesis project allowed me to dive into the contemporary artists I was researching, and it really pushed me to work on my organizational skills when writing. I have never had to write anything so lengthy, so I really learned how to structure a thesis so that it is a clear as possible.
I learned how to research, conceptualize, outline, and write, and edit a long art historical paper. I also learned how to develop a complex argument and express my ideas as effectively as possible.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I loved the workshops, it was a great way to get some feedback from peers.
It was great. My advisor made time to meet with me weekly, and she provided thoughtful comments early enough so that I had time to edit before the deadline.

I think it was as good as it could have been in a virtual formatit was nice to get feedback from other students and to present our research at the colloquium. For the colloquium, I understand that they didn't want it to run too long, but I felt like five minutes was a little short to effectively present a project of that size. Also, it was really hard without a spring break, but hopefully that won't happen again!

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I'm not sure if the workshops this year were as long as normal, but having them virtual made them feel super long and I think everyone was really tired by the end. Maybe it would have been better to have them broken up into two shorter ones.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: You don't really have a choice...

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Independent senior essay writing with occasional workshops held by the DUS.
Weekly virtual meetings with advisor and DUS. Colloquiums and workshops (virtual).
Senior essay with weekly meetings with the advisor
